1.prompt: What is the page title (<title>) for the current page?

2.prompt: Retrieve the meta description tag (<meta name="description">) for this page.

3.prompt: Extract the meta keywords (<meta name="keywords">) for this page, if present.

4.prompt: Fetch the canonical URL (<link rel="canonical">) tag for this page.

5.prompt: Extract Open Graph meta tags (e.g., <meta property="og:title">, <meta property="og:description">, <meta property="og:image">) from the page.

6.prompt: Extract Twitter Card meta tags (e.g., <meta name="twitter:title">, <meta name="twitter:description">, <meta name="twitter:image">) for this page.

7.prompt: Retrieve the viewport meta tag (<meta name="viewport">) for mobile optimization.

8.prompt: Check if there is a meta author tag (<meta name="author">) and extract its value.

9.prompt: What is the content of the main header (<h1>) tag on this page?

10.prompt: Retrieve all image () alt texts for accessibility and SEO purposes.

11.prompt: Extract any schema.org JSON-LD, Microdata, or RDFa markup from the page (e.g., Article, Product, Review, etc.).

12.prompt: Extract all internal links (<a href>) from the page, including their rel attributes (nofollow, etc.).

13.prompt: Identify and list all external links (<a href>) on the page and check if they have rel="noopener noreferrer".

14.prompt: Retrieve the robots meta tag (<meta name="robots">) and its content to check for crawl instructions (e.g., noindex, nofollow).

15.prompt: Check if the URLs in the page are SEO-friendly (i.e., clean URLs without unnecessary parameters).

16.prompt: Extract the <link rel="alternate" hreflang> tags for any language or regional variations.

17.prompt: Retrieve the favicon URL (<link rel="icon">) from the page.

18.prompt: Check if the page has an AMP version (<link rel="amphtml").

19.prompt: If the page is a news article, extract the structured data related to news (e.g., <meta name="news_keywords"> or NewsArticle schema).

20.prompt: Fetch any other relevant social sharing tags like fb:app_id, twitter:card, etc.

21.prompt: Retrieve the page's load speed data using tools like Google PageSpeed Insights, if available in the headers or response.

22.prompt: Check if the page is optimized for mobile and retrieve any hints from the viewport tag or mobile-specific settings.

23.prompt: Retrieve the content length header (Content-Length) to get an idea of the pageâ€™s size and performance.

24.prompt: Extract any JSON-LD structured data from the page, including product or article data.

25.prompt: Check if the page links to minified versions of CSS and JavaScript files and extract URLs for these files.

26.prompt: Check the page for a link to the XML sitemap (<link rel="sitemap" href="sitemap.xml").

27.prompt: List all crawlable internal links, identifying any links that are potentially blocked by robots.txt or meta tags.

28.prompt: Identify if the site has a robots.txt file and extract its contents to determine which pages or directories are blocked from crawling.

29.prompt: Check the page for any broken links (<a href>) and identify if any 404 errors are returned when the link is followed.

30.prompt: Detect if there are any HTTP 301/302 redirects on the page and extract the target URL.

31.prompt: If available, extract the page rank or SEO score provided by tools like Ahrefs or Moz.

32.prompt: Extract information related to backlinks pointing to the page, if available.

33.prompt: If this is a product page, extract product schema (e.g., price, availability, brand, SKU).

34.prompt: If the page has embedded videos, extract metadata related to the videos (e.g., <meta property="og:video").

35.prompt: Retrieve the general site meta tags like site name, default description, and author from the header section.

36.prompt: Check if there are any footer SEO elements like legal disclaimers, sitemap links, or other footer-based meta tags.
